explanation: The reported violation is not proven from the shown ahc_cb function alone. ahc_cb does not itself call any <string.h> functions on ws_key_header; it obtains a pointer and an explicit length (key_size) from MHD_lookup_connection_value_n and checks key_size == WS_KEY_LEN before calling ws_get_accept_value(ws_key_header, &ws_ac_value). The potential out-of-bounds read that Agent A describes would occur only if ws_get_accept_value internally uses string.h functions that expect a NUL-terminated C string (e.g. strlen, strcpy) while ws_key_header is not NUL-terminated. That would be a violation located inside ws_get_accept_value, not in ahc_cb. Therefore the claim that ahc_cb itself violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is not correct as presented. Recommend either (a) ensure ws_key_header is NUL-terminated before passing it, or (b) change ws_get_accept_value to accept a length parameter and use bounded memory/string functions (or mem* with known length) to avoid any out-of-bounds access.
